entry.title: Bring back Manifest V2 extensions to Chrome!
entry.summary: In Chrome 140 (and possibly 139), Manifest V2 extensions are "no longer" supported. This is not the case, as the browser still internally supports these extensions. Through some digging in the Chromium source, we discovered that there is actually a command-line flag to re-enable these…
entry.content:
In Chrome 140 (and possibly 139), Manifest V2 extensions are "no longer" supported. This is not the case, as the browser still internally supports these extensions. Through some digging in the Chromium source, we discovered that there is actually a command-line flag to re-enable these extensions. 

When launching Chrome, append the following flag to the executable:

--disable-features=ExtensionManifestV2Disabled,ExtensionManifestV2Unsupported,ExtensionManifestV2DeprecationWarning,ExtensionsManifestV3Only

This flag re-enables Manifest V2 extensions and also hides the deprecation warning in chrome://extensions

This was discovered in the run_py_tests.py file in the Chromium source, which has a test that disables Google's absurd decision. The extension_features.cc file has various "features" relating to disabling Manifest v2, which is where ExtensionManifestV2DeprecationWarning and ExtensionsManifestV3Only were discovered.

entry.title: Microsoft Edge Source Code
entry.summary: You thought Microsoft Edge was proprietary, didn't you. Well, because of Panasonic (of all things), we have the source code for Microsoft Edge. You read that title right! Panasonic (of all things) shared the Microsoft Edge source code on their website. The page with the…
entry.content:
You thought Microsoft Edge was proprietary, didn't you. Well, because of Panasonic (of all things), we have the source code for Microsoft Edge.

You read that title right! Panasonic (of all things) shared the Microsoft Edge source code on their website. The page with the downloads is here and the downloads are below:

Version Download
80.0.361.61 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/80.0.361.61_sc.zip
84.0.522.75 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/84.0.522.75_sc.zip
89.0.774.68 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/89.0.774.68_sc.zip
90.0.818.66 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/90.0.818.66_sc.zip
92.0.902.67 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/92.0.902.67_sc.zip
100.0.1185.36 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/100.0.1185.36_sc.zip
106.0.1370.47 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/106.0.1370.47_sc.zip
122.0.2365.106 https://contents.oss-src-distribution.panasonic.com/oss/pc/122.0.2365.106_sc.zip

Hilltraud (on the OpenXP Discord server) also discovered that Microsoft provides partial source for Edge on their Third Party Source site. This source could be merged with the more complete source provided by Panasonic to compile Microsoft Edge.
